requirements.summary: Fix frontend build/deploy issues so the standard IC template workflow produces a working, loadable frontend.
acceptanceCriteria: A clean build completes without errors in the standard project workflow.
A deploy completes without errors and the frontend loads in a browser.

file_operations.description: Create the missing App component imported by frontend/src/main.tsx so the React app compiles and renders a single-page experience. Keep it self-contained and avoid adding extra pages/navigation per non-goals.

Create the missing global stylesheet imported by frontend/src/main.tsx; include Tailwind base layers (if Tailwind is part of the template) and define the red-and-white romantic theme CSS variables used by tailwind.config.js.

Add/restore the frontend package manifest and standard build scripts consistent with the selected build-template-react and initial-app templates. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add/restore Vite configuration needed by the standard template build so the frontend can bundle successfully (no backend changes in this plan). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add/restore TypeScript configuration required for React + Vite builds so compilation succeeds in CI/deploy workflows. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add/restore PostCSS config required for Tailwind processing during build so styles compile without errors. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Ensure the document shell is valid and minimal for Vite (title/meta/viewport already present); adjust only if needed to align with the standard template build output and prevent build-time HTML validation errors.

requirements.summary: Make the single-action experience iPad Chrome friendly with responsive layout, large tap target for the Open button, and no hover-only interactions.
acceptanceCriteria: On a tablet-sized viewport, the button remains fully visible without scrolling.
The "Open" button is easily tappable (no tiny hit area), and the reveal action works via touch.

file_operations.description: Implement responsive single-screen layout that centers content and keeps the primary "Open" button visible on tablet viewports; ensure the interaction is click/tap based (no hover-only gating).
Add global responsive/touch-friendly defaults (e.g., comfortable base sizing, safe-area handling) and enforce the red-and-white romantic theme consistently.

requirements.summary: On clicking "Open", reveal a letter-style view containing the exact provided birthday message text with emojis and the explicit line break.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking "Open" replaces (or overlays) the initial single-action view with a letter-style presentation.
The revealed message text matches the user-provided text exactly, including emojis and the explicit line break between "thi" and "Us".

file_operations.description: Add state-driven reveal behavior: initial view shows only the single primary action; tapping/clicking "Open" transitions to the letter-style presentation.

Create a presentational component that renders the exact provided message text preserving emojis and line breaks (render as pre-wrapped text) and styles it as a letter view; wire it into frontend/src/App.tsx so it is not orphaned.

requirements.summary: Bundle and reference romantic static images locally (no backend fetching) to support the envelope/letter reveal presentation.
acceptanceCriteria: All images used for the envelope/letter reveal are included as static frontend assets and referenced locally.
No frontend code requests images from the backend at runtime.

file_operations.description: Add the required romantic envelope illustration as a static frontend asset used by the initial/reveal presentation (local reference only).
Add the required seamless hearts pattern as a static frontend asset used as the background layer (local reference only).
Add the required letter paper texture as a static frontend asset used by the revealed letter view (local reference only).
Reference the static assets locally from the UI (no runtime backend image fetching) and use them to present an envelope-to-letter reveal feel while preserving the single-action flow.
Apply the letter-paper background (local static asset) and typography/layout styling appropriate for a letter presentation; ensure it remains readable and responsive on iPad Chrome.
Add any global background styling needed to incorporate the hearts pattern (local static asset) while maintaining the red-and-white romantic palette.
